comment.author: 52583849@N04
comment._content: William Avery Bishop, top RFC (and Canadian) ace of WW1 with Nieuport 23 (which is nearly always mis-identified as a 17 - note the crossed cabane rigging which would prevent a gun from being mounted on the centerline - a feature of the 23 - they don't cross on the 17). The censors have not only destroyed the serial number, but also painted out a shack that was behind the aircraft - other copies of the photo have either one of the other.
